import.name: Soul Speech Amulet
import.description: While attuned, a charge can be used to speak with a Lost Soul and grants immunity to becoming Frightened from another creature, as the vast void with which you are now connected is more imposing than any creature. However you have disadvantage on Wisdom saves caused by "Strange" environments that would incur such a save. Some souls are easy to speak with, some will require a Wisdom save to successfully speak with them. If failed, some Psychic damage will likely occur from the feedback of the failed connection. Only known to work in Reykurax, it may work in the Material Plane as well, but expect higher difficulties when attempting to communicate with ghosts. Once used, you can ask a spirit ${10,orange}$ questions. After the 10th question, you may make a Wisdom DC${20,orange}$ save to strain yourself to attempt more questions. On failure, you get another question and suffer 1d12 Psychic damage.
import.note:
+5 to DC in the Material Plane.

+ DC${5,orange}$: Simple Ghost, might know the surroundings but no real pertinent information
+ DC${10,orange}$: Ghost with some information but only light information
+ DC${15,orange}$: Someone directly involved in the inquiry, such as a foot soldier from a battle
+ DC${20,orange}$: A low level leader of some sort
+ DC${30,orange}$: A past king of queen or high stature
+ DC${50,orange}$: The soul of a demi-god
+ DC${70,orange}$: The soul of a god

import.name: Divining Kit
import.description: Can be used to predict imminent events such as where someone has recently hidden or the location of something near by. An Arcana or Religion Check may be used. The information gained as well as the difficulty of the check may vary based on the check used. The difficulty of the checks depends on what information is being sought. When using the kit, ask a simple question, wording being important. Assume any word after the 10th will likely not be understood by the kit. Additionally, a God may be named in the request, but then the attunee must make a Religion Check.

import.name: Tarot Deck
import.description: A tool of deceit or vision, this deck is imbued with magical energy to predict a target creature's fortune. As you flip the cards, you read the creature its fortune. Several skills may be used to invoke this deck's power; If using a charge, the fortune may possess truth and an Arcana or Religion check is used with each turn of a card to determine the accuracy of what you see. Whether you used a charge or not, you may then use a Persuasion or Deception check to convey information to the creature. This may be true or false information. However, depending on the information being sought and the target creature, there may not be a choice to the skill checks. The difficulty of foreseeing is determined by the creature and the cards drawn, along with what you speak as you foretell the creatures fate. These checks can not critical fail or critically succeed, they simply measure the impact. Attempting to read a fortune without attuning results in ${(wis+cha)d6,orange}$ Psychic damage. Can be combined with a Diving Kit to learn additional information in some cases.

import.name: Arcanous Amoria
import.description: A light "wand" accompanied with a long scroll of command words for options and settings; + Distendo - Extend + Exaggero - Enlarge + Reducto - Shrink + Vibro - Vibrate + Inserta - Self Insertion Control + Pulsus - Pulsate + Subsisto - Stop The command words must be spoken, but a whisper will suffice as long as the wand can hear the words spoken. The manual does go on to note that the wand can mis-hear command words if not spoken clearly enough but the magical enchantments do adjust for more "Impassioned" pronunciation of words to ensure a pleasant experience.

import.name: Divnina Arcana
import.description:
A hefty book with a golden binding that has several decorative silver veins running along it, making patterns close to vines along the cover, back, and spine.

It is written in Ancient and is filled with symbols, runes, and power circles that seem to aid in translating Divination like spells to Arcane, and vice versa.

With some understanding of this text, it is possible for a Cleric or Paladin to learn new spells from a Wizard, and vice versa.

The text is extremely complex and intricate and will likely take quite some time to understand.
import.hiddenDescription:
A hefty book with a golden binding that has several decorative silver veins running along it, making patterns close to vines along the cover, back, and spine.

Understanding this book seems to require one to be able to read ${"content":"Ancient","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.
import.note:
Protected by 3 Abjuration Spells, 1 Conjuration spell, and one Divination spell.

Adj Spells
 + Prevent opening
 + 1d4 Psychic damage per word to someone reading it who shouoldn't be
 + 2d8 necrotic damage when holding if not allowed

Conj Spells:
 + All pages appear blank

Div. Spell:
 + Detect who is allowed to read, if gone, no one is allowed to read

import.name: Aevium Orbis
import.description: A complex arcane ritual and powerful runes adorn this scroll, outlining a 4 hour procession of events to achieve the spell, including ${12,orange}$ power crystals; 4 Red, 4 Blue, and 4 Green, as well as the sacrifice of at least 4 living humanoid creatures totaling 50 years of age or more, every year beyond 50 reducing the toll on the creature performing the ritual. If you can not normally cast a level ${10,orange}$ spell, you must pass a ${35,orange}$DC Arcana check is performed to control the spell and direct the temporal bubble it creates. Additional blue crystals can be used to help control the bubble, every additional Blue Power Crystal reducing the DC by ${1,orange}$. Once successfully performed, a small localized area up to ${10 + wis,orange}$ studs in diameter can be shifted through time, causing everything inside to age forward or backwards up to a millennia in the span of ${1,orange}$ minute. If the creature performing the ritual fails the initial Arcana check, they and the sacrifices are cast back from the power circles and suffer 100d10 Necrotic damage. If a creature dies from this, its soul is bound to the realm of the lost and it is considered to have been dead for a millennia though it will not decay as such. Succeed or fail, all power crystals used disintegrate at the start of the ritual, their dust swirling in the power circles drawn on the ground. Once performed, and the ritual complete, the caster must succeed on a ${25,orange}$DC Intelligence save, or their soul is consumed with the others as part of powering the time dilation bubble. The sacrifices provided lose their souls, this may include the caster as noted above. These creatures are considered soulless and dead, their aging and rotting the span of time that the time dilatation bubble spanned. No spell or effect can stop this death. If they are revived by exemplary outside reactionary conditions, their bodies are considered soulless, mindless, and undead and will slowly die from lack of blood flow, oxygen, water, or food as they have no functional brain with which to perform necessary functions.

import.name: Tarot Deck
import.description: A tool of deceit or vision, this deck is imbued with magical energy to predict a target creature's fortune. As you flip the cards, you read the creature its fortune. Several skills may be used to invoke this deck's power; If using a charge, the fortune may possess truth and an Arcana or Religion check is used with each turn of a card to determine the accuracy of what you see. Whether you used a charge or not, you may then use a Persuasion or Deception check to convey information to the creature. This may be true or false information. However, depending on the information being sought and the target creature, there may not be a choice to the skill checks. The difficulty of foreseeing is determined by the creature and the cards drawn, along with what you speak as you foretell the creatures fate. These checks can not critical fail or critically succeed, they simply measure the impact. Attempting to read a fortune without attuning results in ${(wis+cha)d6,orange}$ Psychic damage.

import.name: Book of Recollection
import.description:
A book that helps the person holding the book recall information from their memories, causing them to appear in the pages of the book as something that can be read by any.

As long as it is in their hand they concentrate, the information they are thinking of will easily appear within the pages of the book.

The information recalled slowly fills the book, never erasing. Once the book is full, it becomes an inert tome of the recalled memories.

import.name: Tome of Inscriptions
import.description:
A tome seeming to containing the writings of many, if not all, languages.

The Ancient section covers the various historical moments that serve as segments of the ancient scripts and meanings.

Covered in ${144,orange}$ enchantments, and difficult to distinguish. Many are protection, but some seem to serve to offensively protect the book from those who would steal it.
import.note:
Currently stored in a mechanical and magical field and protected by several abjuration and transmutation spells.

Hidden by Icana towards the end of the ancient civilization to protect ancient knowledge after The Vindica destroyed the other tomes of this knowledge.

import.name: Potion of Greater Restoration
import.description: This potion may be consumed or simply poured upon a creature for the effect to take place. Your body is imbued with positive energy, undoing a single debilitating effect. If you have a specific effect you wish to remove, you can guide the energy within you to remove it, otherwise the magical effect will seek one out at random or may find none. The magic within is extremely powerful and capable of restoring your body from powerful curses and effects. Your exhaustion level can be reduced by one, or end one of the following effects: + Petrified + One Curse (Including attunement to a cursed magical item) + Any reduction to an ability score (Such as Constitution) + Any effect reducing your maximum hit points If you consume this potion while Charmed, then that effect is removed first regardless of any other effects. This potion can not restore life to a creature.
import.note: A Cleric can pray over this potion and consumed to learn the spell while in a temple, though there may be a delay depending on the roll.

import.name: Antilife Scroll
import.description: If you can not normally cast a level ${5,orange}$ spell, you must pass an Arcana DC${15,orange}$ check to successfully use the scroll, or else the cast fizzles. On a successful cast, a shimmering barrier extends out from you for up to ${10,orange}$ minutes in a ${6,orange}$ stud radius and moves with you, remaining centered on you and hedging out creatures other than undead and constructs. Keeping the barrier active requires your concentration and if you are normally unable to cast spells, you are unable to take Bonus Actions on your turn. The barrier prevents an affected creature from passing or reaching through. An affected creature can cast spells or make attacks with ranged or reach weapons through the barrier. If you move so that an affected creature is forced to pass through the barrier, the spell ends.

import.name: Scroll of Scrying
import.description: If you can not normally cast a level ${5,orange}$ spell, you must pass an Arcana DC${15,orange}$ check to successfully use the scroll, or else the cast fizzles expending the scroll. On a successful cast, you can see and hear a particular creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. If a target knows you’re casting this spell, it can fail the saving throw voluntarily if it wants to be observed. Knowledge Save Modifier + Secondhand (you have heard of the target) +5 + Firsthand (you have met the target) +0 + Familiar (you know the target well) −5 + Connection Save Modifier + Likeness or picture −2 + Possession or garment −4 + Body part, lock of hair, bit of nail, or the like −10 On a successful save, the target isn’t affected, and you can’t use this spell against it again for 24 hours. On a failed save, the spell creates an invisible sensor within 10 studs of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 7 studs of it for the duration. A creature that can see invisible objects sees the sensor as a luminous orb about the size of your fist. Instead of targeting a creature, you can choose a location you have seen before as the target of this spell. When you do, the sensor appears at that location and doesn’t move.

import.name: Scroll of Death Ward
import.description: If you can not normally cast a level ${4,orange}$ spell, you must pass an Arcana DC${15,orange}$ check to successfully use the scroll, or else the cast fizzles expending the scroll. On a successful cast, you touch a creature and grant it a measure of protection from death. The first time the target would drop to ${0,orange}$ hit points as a result of taking damage, the target instead drops to ${1,orange}$ hit point, and the spell ends. If the spell is still in effect when the target is subjected to an effect that would kill it instantaneously without dealing damage, that effect is instead negated against the target, and the spells ends. The enchanted creature gains the effect Death Warded.
import._search: scroll of death warditem:scroll:deathwardif you can not normally cast a level ${4,orange}$ spell, you must pass an arcana dc${15,orange}$ check to successfully use the scroll, or else the cast fizzles expending the scroll. on a successful cast, you touch a creature and grant it a measure of protection from death. the first time the target would drop to ${0,orange}$ hit points as a result of taking damage, the target instead drops to ${1,orange}$ hit point, and the spell ends. if the spell is still in effect when the target is subjected to an effect that would kill it instantaneously without dealing damage, that effect is instead negated against the target, and the spells ends. the enchanted creature gains the effect death warded.scroll

import.name: Soulmist Bomb
import.description:
Creates a mist composed of a magical dust that obscures normal and magical vision for all creatures except the creature that threw the bomb, granting them advantage on all attacks against creatures inside the mist that fail the bomb's DC.

Once thrown, the bomb explodes against the ground creating a ${16,orange}$ stud radius mist cloud.

import.name: Entwined Soulmist Bomb

import.name: Banner of Gathering
import.description: A special banner that can be thrust into the ground as an action at any time, channeling the power of your god to your allies. The effects vary by the god you worship or to the god to whom you call out to when planting this banner. When placed, name a god and perform a Religion check. The effect of this banner is to provide advantage on ${2,orange}$ skill checks to those in the inner area and ${1,orange}$ skill to those in the outer area. The skills are determined by the god and the result of your skill check when planting the banner. This banner has ${10,orange}$HP and ${10+int,orange}$AC while planted and, once placed, can not be retrieved until combat has ended. Once retrieved, the banner is considered healed. Only ${1,orange}$ banner may be active for you and your allies at a time. If multiple are placed, the first one simply ceases to apply its effect. It may still be collected after the battle and retains its enchanting effect.

import.name: Banner of Power
import.description:
A special banner that can be thrust into the ground as an action at any time, channeling arcane power to those near-by.

Creatures in the banner's radius have advantage on normal and magical attack rolls. Creatures in the extended range only have advantage on normal attacks.

This banner has ${10,orange}$HP and ${10+int,orange}$AC while planted and, once placed, can not be retrieved until combat has ended. Once retrieved, the banner is considered healed.

Only ${1,orange}$ banner may be active for you and your allies at a time. If multiple are placed, the first one simply ceases to apply its effect. It may still be collected after the battle and retains its enchanting effect.

import.name: Scroll of Hold Monster
import.description: If you can not normally cast a level ${5,orange}$ spell, you must pass an Arcana DC${17,orange}$ check to successfully use the scroll, or else the cast fizzles expending the scroll. On a successful cast, choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed its saving throw or be paralyzed for the duration. This spell has no effect on undead. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another save, ending the spell early on success. Succeed or fail at casting the spell, you take 1d4 of Psychic damage. The paralysis expires after 2 rounds. The runes here-in work to counter the concentration requirements of the true spell, allowing it to be cast but not to be effectively copied as this is a tarnished version of the spell.

import.name: Umoya Crystal
import.description:
Soul gems are known from old dark magic, little is known about them other than they hold the soul of a dead creature and can be used in alchemical and arcane rituals.

With the right handling, the soul can be released from the gem.
import.hiddenDescription: A violet gem with a low dark glow.
import.note:
Successful arcana check against the gem can release the soul or summon it back into its body if the body is present.

If the gem is empty, it can be used at half it's DC to resurrect a creature who has been dead for less than 1 minute.

import.name: Speech Pills of the Outer Realms
import.description: Pill to learn a new language. The general instructions are listed in several languages, including common, however the ritual listed seems to require understanding Ancient to perform accurately, but enough is explained to try. If you don't understand Ancient, make a Wisdom DC${25,orange}$ Save. On success, you learn a language of your choice from below. However a critical failure will result in your brain being overwhelmed and you will take 5d10 Psychic damage. If you do understand Ancient, you may simply choose a new language to learn. Learn one of the languages of the lower realms, The Fey Wilds, Shadowfell, The Aether, and The Great Plains, listed below: + Sylvan + Druidic + Deep Speech + Kintarian
import.hiddenDescription: Some weird symbols mark the box, they appear to be in ancient.
import.note: Inscriptions match the languages on the outer mid-level wrap of  the Citadel entrance

import.name: Scroll of Arc Field
import.description: If you can not normally cast a level ${4,orange}$ spell, you must pass an Arcana DC${15,orange}$ check to successfully use the scroll, or else the cast fizzles expending the scroll. On a successful cast, a field appears on the ground, electrifying any creatures inside a ${25,orange}$ stud radius of a chosen point on the ground. This applies to any creatures, both friend and foe on the ground in the area. Creatures that succeed on their save take half damage. In addition to taking damage, the field makes the area Difficult Terrain Any creature that takes more than ${30,orange}$ damage of Lightning after reductions becomes Paralyzed.

import.name: Scroll of Spellsiphon
import.description: If you can not normally cast a level ${6,orange}$ spell, you must pass an Arcana DC${15,orange}$ check to successfully use the scroll, or else the cast fizzles expending the scroll. On a successful cast, you interrupt another spell caster's spell. If that spell is cast at the level of your cast of Spell Siphon or lower, the spell is Siphoned. Once a spell is siphoned, you know of the spell and must choose new target(s) for it and you are considered the caster of the new spell. If the spell is higher than your cast level, make an Intelligence save against the casted spell. For example, casting this at ${6,orange}$th level vs a ${8,orange}$th level spell is a DC of "${13,orange}$ + (${6,orange}$ - ${8,orange}$)" for a DC of ${15,orange}$. For another example, casting this at ${6,orange}$th level vs a ${7,orange}$th level spell is a DC of "${13,orange}$ + (${7,orange}$ - ${6,orange}$)" for a DC of ${14,orange}$.

import.name: Byrjaren Bracers
import.description:
Dwarven bracers forged with inlaid golden runes. Allows the wearer to instantly recall a thrown weapon and the weapon will teleport back to their hand.

Must recall the weapon within ${6,orange}$ seconds and their is no distance limit on recalling the weapon.

If the weapon is surrendered instead of thrown, it can not be recalled.

If the weapon is unintentionally dropped or stolen, it can be recalled.

import.name: Bone Golem Scroll
import.description: If you can not normally cast a level ${4,orange}$ spell, you must pass an Arcana DC${15,orange}$ check to successfully use the scroll, or else the cast fizzles expending the scroll. On a successful cast, with the pressence of ${5,orange}$ skeletal summons under your control, you construct a Bone Golem from 5 of those skeletons over the course of ${15 - int,orange}$ minutes. Studying this scroll conveys knowledge of Bone Golems and conveys a sense of more powerful magics involving the use of Power Crystals but none of the steps in the scroll's ritual seem to require them.
import.hiddenDescription: Mentions Golems and Bones but a few portions don't quite make sense...
import.note:
Uses a few arcane circles that are lost ancient, but its low level allows it to be read and interpreted without understanding of those circles.

An Investigation or Arcana check can reveal that there is some ancient information within the scroll.

import.name: Vo Soi Sin
import.description:
Can be filled with sea water and hums gently when full.

Once per long rest when successfully striking a creature, you may opt to use a charge to empty the stored sea water into the target for an additional ${(pro)d4, orange}$ Sonic damage.

The dagger can be filled even when a charge is not available but it does still hum gently.
import.hiddenName: Simple Dagger with a Seashell Hilt
import.hiddenDescription: A nicely balanced dagger that has a seashell for a hilt.
import.note:
The Merfolk of the Capoe Sea have taken an interest in the happenings above with the awakening of Waitiri's temple.

Fish and other sea creatures and gently drawn to the dagger when it is humming. The effect is amplified when in the water and results in a disadvantage on aquatic stealth rolls.

The Merfolk King uses this to scry above, but expected the Kintari to take it and they did not.

import.name: Lost Journal
import.description: Written in common the journal is easily read. The journal seems to be the last few weeks of a man named Iqoli. Most of the entries seem to be regarding his normal life in Somewhere in Draconia, but at some point he notes that he was walking through the town square and suddenly found himself here. Running through the vast plains he struggled to stay alive, burying himself in the sands to sleep to protect himself from the creatures above and eventually stumbling onto some demons who seemed to pay him no mind and followed them back to a city, letting them clear the way. Reaching the city he found the Soul Speech Amulet being sold at LemSim that would let him speak with the ghosts and he had hoped that he could use that to speak with them to find a way out, though he notes the shop keeper seemed to think that a crazy thought. To buy the necklace he needed gold or Umoya Crystals, and it would seem that 10 crystals would do the trick. Spending the last few gold coins he had to purchase some weapons seems to be the last entry.
import.note: DC15 to Determine where in draconia the man was from: Simer
import._search: lost journalitem:book:lost:commonerwritten in common the journal is easily read. the journal seems to be the last few weeks of a man named iqoli. most of the entries seem to be regarding his normal life in somewhere in draconia, but at some point he notes that he was walking through the town square and suddenly found himself here. running through the vast plains he struggled to stay alive, burying himself in the sands to sleep to protect himself from the creatures above and eventually stumbling onto some demons who seemed to pay him no mind and followed them back to a city, letting them clear the way. reaching the city he found the soul speech amulet being sold at lemsim that would let him speak with the ghosts and he had hoped that he could use that to speak with them to find a way out, though he notes the shop keeper seemed to think that a crazy thought. to buy the necklace he needed gold or umoya crystals, and it would seem that 10 crystals would do the trick. spending the last few gold coins he had to purchase some weapons seems to be the last entry.dc15 to determine where in draconia the man was from: simerbook

import.name: Diggers Journal
import.description: Written in Sylvan, this journal is a bit tricky to read if the language is not spoken. ---- Seems to be the journal of a digger from the Fey Wild who came here in search of some kind of ancient treasure. ---- There are tombs scattered about the continent where the ancients laid some of the "celebrities" to rest along with some of their valuables for them to take into the after life. ---- These tombs are quite well guarded, spirits are bound to them and the celebrities themselves are present, though not likely to be much of a threat themselves. Some areas also protected by puzzles and riddles, leading to secret passages and such as well. ---- Evens and odds seem to be of note in some tombs. Not sure in what way though... may warrant more investigation... --- Golems seem pretty common for defending... Watch the floor, color seems to change and need interrupted somehow... Definitely don't let it turn white --- Got a ghost to talk that knew a bit about the tombs. Managed to learn that if you die in the tomb, it'll kick your spirit out. Gotta remember to leave some stuff outside the tomb in case my spirit needs to grab it... --- Searching through the book you find descriptions of the location of a tomb to the northeast. Requires a Navigation check DC${10,orange}$ to locate the tomb. Can be performed once per long rest. --- Searching through the book you find descriptions of the location of a tomb on the southeast coast. Requires a Navigation check DC${15,orange}$ to locate the tomb. Can be performed once per long rest. --- Trying a tomb I stumbled on, not sure how to note this location, no features seem to be near by. Hopefully manage to finish before a ghost grabs my stuff.... --- And that seems to be the end of it. Though after reading through some of the foot notes, it would seem he used Elixir or Morletum to speak with the dead.
import.hiddenDescription: A thick book that will take some time to read if you can figure out the language and how to read it...
import.note:
DC15 navigation to find a map, one check per day.
 - Ancient Tombs (Location of 2: Set wherever)
    - location:tomb:ancient:0
    - location:tomb:ancient:1

import.name: Explorer's Journal
import.description: A thick book that will take some time to read if you can figure out the language and how to read it... Writing comes off as a bit pompous and full of himself. Reading through it with Comprehend Languages, you make out some of the text. --- Large and extensive, seems to cover the journeys of a Kenku named Carian Lightfoot who came to this realm in search of a lost city. --- The journal notes the Pillar of Resurrection and that the living can pay the Ferryman a Coin of Styx to cross that a feat of strength and intellect must be passed to return to the material plane. Though the location of arrival is noted as "wonky". Though this is not ultimately what he was searching for. However, he doesn't seem to note where this pillar is located. --- He flies over the city of Stjornu noting that it appeared boring and of little interest. --- Noting the small islands he seems to have written out a way to find the lost city of Vefsioni on one of the islands. He writes at some length about the issues with the "Dead Sea" and that crossing without the assistance of the Ferryman is considered impossible, but simply flying over the sea should be quite easy... This is the last entry in the journal.
import.hiddenDescription: A journal of some kind currently encased in a magical matrix.
import.note: Current: 54 Investigation: [0] Written in Auran, this journal is a bit tricky to read if the language is not spoken. (Using Comprehend Languages to read) [70] It would seem that the book is instilled with a kind of signal that can be felt while holding it once the full book has been read. A Navigation check DC${20,orange}$ might reveal where he thought the city to be located, but attempting to discern this information seems to be protected. There appear to be ${3,orange}$ attempts at discerning the location remaining before the impression fades...

import.name: Prisoner Account
import.description: Bears a mark on the first page: Beyond that, you've learned some things by investigating the book...
import.hiddenDescription: A strange book that has a notable symbol on the first page: That aside, you're not able to distinguish this ancient book from the others. You suspect that you'll need to be able to read ancient to understand it.
import.note:
Found in the ruins of Hwand in a government records building.

Has level 10 conjuration, abjuration ,and divination magic on it. Successfully dispelling any of them results in a recasting of it by the conjuration magic, DC40 investigation magic to distinguish them, 4 of them all cast to maintain all other spells, 4 successful dispells targeting each individually has a chance at working.

Investigation Rolls - Currently ${0,orange}$
+ 25: The writing  actually appears to change in some cases
+ 100: You make out that the majority of the information here-in seems to be in some kind of list
+ 300 (History DC20): Working through the text, you make out that some things appear to possibly be names.

import.name: Red Rock Rider
import.description: While holding this orb, you are compelled to go to the nearest creature and punch it. If there are multiple creatures near-by of seemingly similar range, roll a D20 for each until you roll higher than 10, then you travel at max speed (Including abilities and items) and punch that creature. When punching a creature, you deal an additional 6d6 Bludgeoning and 6d6 Lightning damage and feel a surge of pleasure from striking that creature. To release the ball, you must pass a Wisdom Save at DC${18,orange}$.
import.hiddenDescription: Black lightning appears frozen within the smooth red crystalline surface of this ball. You managed to unlock the encasing field on Umqavum 21, 318Session 41.
import.note:
If attuned to the ball, the creature punches for 12d6 in each category instead, but retains the crazed drive. Additionally, unattuning causes that damage back upon the creature.

The max range for sensing a creature is visual. To tame the orb, a creature must isolate itself for 15 days within a meditation circle, then the Wisdom saves and crazed drive are gone.

Holding the ball with anything short of 1 inch of lead or at least 3 studs of pole still gives influence.

import.name: Opulence
import.description: A coin purse seemingly filled with an uncountable number of coins.
import.icon: fad fa-sack-dollar rs-secondary-dark-green rs-secondary-solid rs-secondary-dark-yellow rs-white
import.hiddenDescription: A fanciful coin purse with "Opulence" embroidered on it in several languages and seemingly filled with gold coins. You managed to unlock the encasing field on Umqavum 21, 318Session 41.
import.note: Coins can be taken out in any amount to be shown or viewed but reaching into the bag with the intent to spend coins results in no coins being found in the pouch despite it looking full. When held for any longer than 5 minutes, the creatures coins are all stolen. Coins taken out from the bag magically vanish if left out too long or if the holder's intent changes. --- The coin purse contains the coins of all those who it has robbed. Current: 237,637.1G (3 with Eldith) Getting coins from the purse requires trickery and subtle wording. The effective Insight of the wallet is +${15,orange}$ and has advantage against any creature that has held it for any length of time. Has Enchantment magic on it. If disenchanted, the coin purse falls to a normal purse and becomes empty with all the stolen coins lost to a pocket dimension.

import.name: Frozen Sheath
import.description: Some kind of specialty piece, enchanted with Frost Abjuration magic and bears a golden insignia on its blue leather: While worn, any magic cast that deals Cold damage deals an additional 1d8 damage. As an action, you can encase your self in ice using your Temporary HP to encase your self in a block of ice for up to ${wis,orange}$ turns. Until the spell ends or until the ice block is broken, you heal for 1d8 at the end of each turn. You are still conscious while encased in ice and can control or continue to concentrate on any spells already active. Damage to the ice does not induce a Concentration roll.
import.hiddenDescription: A decorated but used blue leather chest armor piece that is cold to the touch. Bears a small insignia on it in gold:
import.note: Old armor of the Vindica. Runs the risk of being seen by someone who knows. Also being unable to account for the insignia may alert some guards.

import.name: Mountainous Plate
import.description: A heavy protective enchantment sits upon this plate armor and seems to project your pressence out further than you actually are. You instantly fail any Dexterity save forced upon you. For any Area of effect spells that happen near you, you act as a wall blocking a cone from the epicenter of the explosion. If you are the epicenter of the explosion, the radius is considered ${0,orange}$ and you are the sole target of the spell. When struck by a spell, you may use a charge to roll the same number of dice as the unmodified, lowest level version of that spell to heal up to the damage you received. Additionally, you count as partial cover for allies immediately adjacent to you if a ranged attack comes from the opposite side of you.
import.hiddenDescription: Extremely heavy and yet compact, this chest piece bears a symbol on it: Seems to have Abjuration magic upon it.

import.name: Royal Cloak
import.description: A simple cloak bearing a insignia on it. Having invoked Legend Lore, against this cloak, you've learned its history; That it was worn by someone who seemed to be an aid to the king, consulting with the royal family and helping to move things around the castle. As the visions continued, the castle appeared to be under attack, guards busily running down hallways and a familiar chaos in the rooms. As the vision came to an end, it was noted that the aid, with a dozen others from the castle, had retreated into the cellar area and hid where the cload was found. A bright shining creature of seemingly pure energy the last sight of those in the room, a flash of light the only scene between the aid in the room and Quincy retrieving the cloak.
import.hiddenDescription: A simple cloak bearing a insignia on it. Found in Hwand.
import._search: royal cloakitem:cloak:ancient:royala simple cloak bearing a insignia on it. having invoked legend lore, against this cloak, you've learned its history; that it was worn by someone who seemed to be an aid to the king, consulting with the royal family and helping to move things around the castle. as the visions continued, the castle appeared to be under attack, guards busily running down hallways and a familiar chaos in the rooms. as the vision came to an end, it was noted that the aid, with a dozen others from the castle, had retreated into the cellar area and hid where the cload was found. a bright shining creature of seemingly pure energy the last sight of those in the room, a flash of light the only scene between the aid in the room and quincy retrieving the cloak.cloak

import.name: Dýrio
import.description: When casting a spell through this wand, roll ${1,orange}$d4 to determine the extra damage type and ${1,orange}$d8 to determine the amount of extra damage. Depending on the distance to the spell's target, the bonus damage may not take effect. For the 1d4: 1. Poison damage. 2. Acid damage. 3. Fire damage. 4. Poison damage with the 1d8 roll doubled. At any time, a charge can be used while casting a spell to additionally summon local creatures to attack the target(s), with a maximum number of creatures proportional to your Wisdom modifier (${wis,orange}$).
import.hiddenDescription: An unknown green wand.
import.note: Dwarven for Beast

import.name: Knocked Chime
import.description: A small musical-esq mythril chime adorns this silver chain necklace with part of the chain hanging with the chime. A charge may be used by striking the chime with the chain, making a Performance check, causing all locks within audible range to unlock and all doors or other passages to move to an open state. Magical locks and doors open based on their difficulty and the rolled Performance check.

On a Long Rest, you reduce the amount of time needed for a full rest by ${1,orange}$ hour per charge used. On a short rest, a charge may be used to gain 1d12 of Healing.

import.name: Alchemist's Journal
import.description: Large and extensive, seems to cover alchemical ways of speaking with the dead. The author goes on to describe special flowers and soil found only in Reykurax. Having read the book more thoroughly, you now know how to identify Necrasoil and Dauoa Flowers.
import.hiddenDescription: A thick book that will take some time to read if you can figure out the language and how to read it...
import.note: Investigation: [0] Written in Abyssal, this journal is a bit tricky to read if the language is not spoken. --- [60] The book notes progress in brewing a potion that achieves her goals but is still finding some issues. The elixir does seem to work better in Reykurax than in the Material Plane. [85] Contains the recipe for the brewing of a Elixir of Morletum, which allows the user to speak with dead spirits. [100] Possession of this book while able to read it reduces the difficulty of brewing a Elixir of Morletum by 5.

import.name: Temporal Knot
import.description: A powerful runic enchantment encloses a half green, half blue, power crystal atop a golden chain. While attuned, you may use the charges to manipulate localized small fragments of time within range. In Combat, you may use a charge to re-roll your Initiative or to have another creature re-roll its Initiative. This can only be used at the start of a round after you know who the current first creature of the round is. A charge can also be used as a Reaction to have any creature in combat re-roll an Attack, Damage, or Saving Throw roll. Outside of combat, this can be used to have any creature re-roll a performed Skill Check. Because of the temporal distortion, this occurs with no save. However some creatures may be resistant to this occurring with varying levels of awareness to the distortion occuring.
import.hiddenDescription: A runes encloses a half green, half blue, power crystal atop a golden chain.
import._search: temporal knotitem:temporalknota powerful runic enchantment encloses a half green, half blue, power crystal atop a golden chain. while attuned, you may use the charges to manipulate localized small fragments of time within range. in combat, you may use a charge to re-roll your initiative or to have another creature re-roll its initiative. this can only be used at the start of a round after you know who the current first creature of the round is. a charge can also be used as a reaction to have any creature in combat re-roll an attack, damage, or saving throw roll. outside of combat, this can be used to have any creature re-roll a performed skill check. because of the temporal distortion, this occurs with no save. however some creatures may be resistant to this occurring with varying levels of awareness to the distortion occuring.amulet

import.name: Spirit's Vow: Purrsalot
import.description: A silver bracelet with a Blue Power Crystal inlaid with small runic script in the silver that you know to read "Sir Purrsalot" and a small cat toy dangling from it. While attuned to this bracelet, you perform an Animal Handling skill check every morning, adding the rolled value to this item's charges. Once at 100 charges, a spirit cat appears for you; Sir Purrsalot. After appearing, you continue to perform an Animal Handling every morning, but this now determines what Sir Purrsalot will do that day: + Critical Failure: Spends the day following you around meowing for food, all creatures can hear him and all creature can see him. Even if the bracelet is unattuned, he will continue to exist and pester you, even through your sleep, should you manage to sleep. + 0-5: Spends the day following you around meowing for food, however only you can see or hear him. When you attempt to sleep, roll a d100 for every hour you are asleep, on a 20 or less, Sir Purrsalot wakes you by pawing your face, distinctly asking for food. + 6-10: Quietly stalks the area around you looking for treats or presents. His posture will change depending on how he feels or if he's found something. + 11-15: Sits on your shoulder and purrs. Giving you advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws. + 15-20: Sits on your shoulder and purrs and others see him as a stark white cat in adorable armor. Giving you advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws as well as Persuassion checks. + 21-30: Sits on your shoulder and purrs but will assist in combat. You have advantage on Wisdom and Charisma and in combat Sir Purrsalot will join the fray dealing 1d4 Slashing damage and moving around the field distracting enemies. Sir Purrsalot is immune to physical damage and can only be removed by being dispelled or other high level manipulation magic. Usually resulting in him simply returning to your shoulder. + 31+: Sir Purrsalot lounges on your shoulder and you are able to speak with him in Common. Any requests of him will depend on his mood and how you've treated him. Gain the effect Purring Cat when appropriate.
import.hiddenDescription: A silver bracelet with a Blue Power Crystal inlaid with small runic script in the silver and a small cat toy dangling from it...
import.note: Made in Reykurax

import.name: Bracelet of Foresight
import.description: Silver runes line the deep blue band of this bracelet, allowing the wearer to change the fate of creatures around them. When a creature in range rolls to deal Damage, whether by Attack or Spell, you may use a charge to have any creature in range reroll a single damage per charge used. Any creature in the furthest range can have a single die manipulated once, any creature inside the inner range can have any number of die manipulated. This bracelet can only manipulate die involved in determining damage dealt.

import.name: Odd note from Hwand
import.description: Quickly scribbled notes sit atop this silken paper.
import.note: [Written in Dwarven] The crypt golem is acting wierd, need to follow up on a few things: + The color alignment for the floor isn't working, once the green power crystals power the floor the golem doesn't get empowered correctly + The Even/Odd crystal count isn't responding correctly to open the doors in the right order + He does seem to at least achieve invulnerability once all 3 base crystal powers are lined up I suspect we inverted a power coupler last night while drinking and swearing up and down that the installation of the nephew's tomb in Reykurax was supposed to be easy and it was anything but. Self note, no more drinking on the job.

import.name: Rurgo's Alchemy Extensions
import.description: Seems to be bearing Conjuration and Transmutation magics, this set of vials and mixing tools seem augment those of an Alchemist's Kit. These additions greatly improve one's ability to create alchemical concoctions. You managed to unlock the encasing field on Umqavum 21, 318Session 41.
import.hiddenDescription: A set of vials and mixing equipment seemingly meant to extend those of an Alchemist's Kit. You managed to unlock the encasing field on Umqavum 21, 318Session 41.
import.note: Cursed with Rurgo's ghost, any attempts to use it without befriending him result in an additional -${10,orange}$ to Alchemist Kit checks. Additionally, Rurgo being a jester of sorts, occasionally brews innocuous bombs of sorts, causing ones pack or room to occasionally explode with smoke or the like. Rurgo's alignment was that of Adjuration. Once befriended and calmed the negative modifier is removed and the surprise bombs ceasee. The user also gains advantage when brewing Abjuration potions.

import.name: Luck's Future
import.description: Runic symbols for luck seem to decorate each card of the deck, calling on Luck's Grace for the reader. You may make a tarot reading of any creature or yourself. However, when performing a reading on yourself, roll 3 d20s to determine the Skill Checks that are effected (Or perform an actual Tarot Reading) and after each roll, perform a skill check and note the saved rolls that you can use later to replace any roll for that skill check: 1. Acrobatics 2. Animal Handling 2. Arcana 2. Athletics 2. Concentration 2. Deception 2. History 2. Initiative 2. Insight 2. Intimidation 2. Investigation 2. Medicine 2. Nature 2. Perception 2. Performance 2. Persuasion 2. Religion 2. Sleight of Hand 2. Stealth 2. Survival Any skill check made over the day can be replaced by the saved roll. You managed to unlock the encasing field on Umqavum 21, 318Session 41.
import.hiddenDescription: An intriguing set of tarot cards with runic tapestry. You managed to unlock the encasing field on Umqavum 21, 318Session 41.
import.note: When used without befriending Grace, a laugh can be heard and the creature suffers a critical fail. If replacing a critical fail, the creature also suffers 2d6 Psychic damage. To befriend Grace, must attune with the bracers and only use the rolls for things she sees fit. Grace's Loves: + Animals + Song + Writing + History

import.name: Banner of Power
import.description:
A special banner that can be thrust into the ground as an action at any time, channeling arcane power to those near-by.

Creatures in the banner's radius have advantage on normal and magical attack rolls. Creatures in the extended range only have advantage on normal attacks.

This banner has ${10,orange}$HP and ${10+int,orange}$AC while planted and, once placed, can not be retrieved until combat has ended. Once retrieved, the banner is considered healed.

Only ${1,orange}$ banner may be active for you and your allies at a time. If multiple are placed, the first one simply ceases to apply its effect. It may still be collected after the battle and retains its enchanting effect.

import.name: Seer's Glasses
import.description: A pair of runic glass lenses are set in this golden frame. A charge can be used as an Action to see the true form of any creature or object for ${2*wis,orange}$ minutes. When a charge is used, roll a Perception check. Any object or creature that is not hiding will be revealed, however those that have made a Stealth check will only be fully visible if you beat their roll. Otherwise you will see nothing or they will appear as "distorted" but you will not be able to make out their true form. Limited only by your normal vision. Can extend through non-magical Spyglasses, however magical ones will require an Arcana check to handle the multiple magics effectively.
import.note:
Expensive for the number of enchantments present and the lack of attunement

+ 1 Enchantment per lense
+ 1 For the frame to carry the sight
+ 1 For sustaining the sight
+ 1 To allude Attunement

import.name: Bracers of Separation
import.description: Each bracer is composed of 2 rings that interlock magically. While attuned, each may be separated as an Action (2 Actions to separate both). The bracers allow you to maintain control of your hands and you continue to feel sensations from them as normal. The separation is painless though it may take some getting used to for controlling your hands (Sleight of Hand). Should you lose attunement while your hands are separated however it is as though your hands have been cut off at the bracers.

import.name: Moonscythe Staff
import.description: A large staff with a crescent moon shaped and styled scythe at the top. Seemingly more for decoration than utility, but the blade is sturdy and harmful none the less. When an attack or spell successfully hits at night with view of the sky, any number of charges can be used to call down a beam of moonlight for an additional 1d8 Radiant damage per charge used. On a full moon this becomes 1d12.

import.name: Shattered Power
import.description: A large heavy war hammer with a specially crafted back to the hammers head piece that allows a power crystal to be locked into place. While attuned and wielding this, you additionally critical on a ${19,orange}$ When a crystal is inserted, this war hammer resets to max charges. The crystal is consumed and not usable after being attached, however it can be removed, at which point it disintegrates if any part of it is left. When striking a creature, on a critical, a charge can be spent, a burst of energy exploding forth from the war hammer and fracturing the crystal. The effect varies with the power crystal that is used. + **Red**: Explodes for in a fiery flash in a 10 stud radius around you dealing 2d6 Fire damage (Not multiplied by the critical) to all creatures in the area except you. These creatures make a Dexterity DC${10+wis,orange}$ saving throw and take half damage on success. + **Blue**: Up to ${wis,orange}$ creatures of your choice in ${30,orange}$ studs of you receive 6d6 Temporary HP. + **Green**: Deal an additional 1d8 Poison damage (Multiplied with the critical strike as usual) and heals you for 2d6 damage. + **Orange**: Unknown + **Lime**: Unknown + **Silver**: Unknown + **Gold**: Unknown
import.note: A weapon of the ancient blacksmiths of old, this is the last of its kind and its knowledgeis lost to time.

import.name: Decree
import.description: Spells cast through this wand exert a great pressure over those struck by the spell. When dealing damage with a spell cast through this wand, each creature receives an additional 1d4 Psychic damage, regardless of how many creatures are struck. When casting a single target spell, a charge can be used to submit the target to an additional Constitution save against your Spell DC and on failure, that creature loses ${1,orange}$d6 worth of spell slots (1 Level 6, or 6 Level 1s, any combination totaling the rolled value in levels).
import.hiddenDescription: An unknown dark blue wand.
import.note: Dwarven for Beast

import.name: Wandering Dust
import.description:
Allows the attuned creature to pull forth a handful of dust that can be cast across a floor, wall, or ceiling to create a portal.

To complete a portal, one handful of dust must be laid out somewhere and a small arcane chant said over it where a ${"content":"Arcana","class":"rs-orange"}$ Check is made. Then, in another location no more than ${20,orange}$ times your ${"content":"Wisdom","class":"rs-orange"}$ Modifier studs away (${20*wis,orange}$), another handful of dust can be scattered and another ${"content":"Arcana","class":"rs-orange"}$ Check made.

On success, a Portal is created that connects the 2 locations and allows at least ${int,orange}$ number of creatures through before collapsing, but may allow more.

The stability and success of the portal depend on a number of factors determined by where the portal is created and the difficulty involved will vary according. However, on a completely open unoccupied field, the portal can not fail to create.

<sub>There have been cases reported of people traveling through the portal finding themselves briefly in another realm and coming out with moderate ${"content":"Fire","class":"rs-orange"}$ or ${"content":"Poison","class":"rs-orange"}$ damage that seems to related to issues with portal stability.</sub>

import.name: Cape of Invisibility
import.description: While heavier than it looks, this cape allows the attuned to become invisible for a period of time equal to your ${Wisdom,orange}$ Modifier (${wis,orange}$) in hours when a charge is used. This invisibility is ended when you take any Action. Use of multiple charges does not stack, the invisibility merely ends the duration of time from the last used charge. If the cape is and removed while the invisibility is active, the invisibility ends, and the cape can be removed by force while you are invisible. The invisibility does not extend to any other creature, regardless of that creature's position to you.

import.name: Amnesia Dust
import.description:
Dust slowly fills the pouch using the excess energy from the attuned creature.

When a creature is exposed to the dust, it must make a ${Wisdom,orange}$ DC${8 + wis,orange}$ save or forget the last ${minute,orange}$ from its memory.

However the dust is difficult to handle and you may expose yourself to the dust. When used, make a ${Sleight,orange}$ ${of,orange}$ ${Hand,orange}$ DC${10-dex,orange}$ Skill Check, and on failure you also forget the last minute.

Any creature effected by forgetfulness has its memory restored when exposed to a Level ${3,orange}$ or higher healing spell.

import.name: Displacer Chest
import.description: Created from the fur of a magical Displacer Beast, when struck a charge can be used to immediately phase yourself into the Ethereal Plane, phasing back after the damage has passed. Area of effect attacks and other such dangers that have more of a persistence damage (Such as Flame Sphere) can have a charge used to immediately succeed the saving throw, however this can not be used after you've rolled for the save as it would be too late. Can hold charges equal to your Dexterity plus your Intelligence Modifiers.

import.name: Grave Ender
import.description: An extremely large and heavy hammer said to have been created by the ancients and identified by the three runes in the hammer's head piece seemingly laid as liquid power crystal, one of red, one of blue, and one of green. Any creature struck dead by this war hammer is Laid to Rest. In addition to not being revivable, the corpse can not be used in anyway. When striking with this hammer, its command word can be spoken to use a charge and invoke one of the 3 runes in the hammer, only 1 rune may be invoked at a time. ### Red The strike deals an additional 2d12 Necrotic damage. ### Blue The target is Silenced for ${1,orange}$ minute. There is no save unless the creature has special resistances. ### Green You heal for ${(con*10)%,orange}$ of the total damage dealt.
import.note: If Ancient is known, any number of runes can be invoked in a single strike, but each rune still consumes a charge. If all three runes are invoked at once, the creature is Marked for Death and will suffer the curse of being Laid to Rest when it dies. There is no terminal duration to Laid to Rest, however it is a curse. Command Word: "Oblivion" in any language

import.name: Speech Pills of the Lower Realms
import.description: Pill to learn a new language. The general instructions are listed in several languages, including common, however the ritual listed seems to require understanding Ancient to perform accurately, but enough is explained to try. If you don't understand Ancient, make a Wisdom DC${25,orange}$ Save. On success, you learn a language of your choice from below. However a critical failure will result in your brain being overwhelmed and you will take 5d10 Psychic damage. If you do understand Ancient, you may simply choose a new language to learn. Learn one of the languages of the lower realms, the Elemental Planes, The Four Hells, and Reykurax, listed below: + Aquan + Primordial + Infernal + Abyssal
import.hiddenDescription: Some weird symbols mark the box, they appear to be in ancient.
import.note: Inscriptions match the languages on the Lower part of  the Citadel entrance

import.name: Spirit's Vow: Meowsaton
import.description: A silver bracelet with a Blue Power Crystal inlaid with small runic script in the silver that you know to read "Meowston" and a small cat toy dangling from it. While attuned to this bracelet, you perform an Animal Handling skill check every morning, adding the rolled value to this item's charges. Once at 100 charges, a spirit cat appears for you; Meowsaton. After appearing, you continue to perform an Animal Handling every morning, but this now determines what Meowsaton will do that day: + Critical Failure: Spends the day following you around meowing for food, all creatures can hear him and all creature can see him. Even if the bracelet is unattuned, he will continue to exist and pester you, even through your sleep, should you manage to sleep. + 0-5: Spends the day following you around meowing for food, however only you can see or hear him. When you attempt to sleep, roll a d100 for every hour you are asleep, on a 20 or less, Meowsaton wakes you by pawing your face, distinctly asking for food. + 6-10: Quietly stalks the area around you looking for treats or presents. His posture will change depending on how he feels or if he's found something. + 11-15: Sits on your shoulder and purrs. Giving you advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws. + 15-20: Sits on your shoulder and purrs and others see him as a stark white cat in adorable armor. Giving you advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws as well as Persuassion checks. + 21-30: Sits on your shoulder and purrs but will assist in combat. You have advantage on Wisdom and Charisma and in combat Meowsaton will join the fray dealing 1d4 Slashing damage and moving around the field distracting enemies. Meowsaton is immune to phystical damage and can only be removed by being dispelled or other high level manipulation magic. Usually resulting in him simply returning to your shoulder. + 31+: Meowsaton lounges on your shoulder and you are able to speak with him in Common. Any requests of him will depend on his mood and how you've treated him. Gain the effect Purring Cat when appropriate.

import.name: Icy Presence
import.description: A frost enchanted necklace that makes your presence fairly known, but is ideal for the cold. Your body temperature is always stable and cool, in the arctic or a desert, but Fire & Cold damage still hurt, though cold much less. You also can not be set on fire or frozen. You have recently learned that this necklace once belonged to the King of an old kingdom called Hintobin. Formed after the fall of the ancient empires but fell more than a hundred years ago. In your search of the lore of this necklace, you learned that it has a connection to ancient officers of the law who would pursue criminals and that many had a necklace such as this and used it to help restrain their person's of interest. That ancient power is still within this necklace, though the ways to reach it seem lost to time. In witnessing the history of the necklace, you saw the King of Hintobin perform a powerful Fireball spell using ${6,orange}$ Red Power Crystals in a circular formation around his arm, seemingly aided by the necklace. As your vision progressed, you saw a rather large city seemingly wiped from existence by the spell before the lore of the necklace seemed to jump forward to it lost at sea before being picked up my merchants.
import.hiddenDescription: An icy white necklace that seems to emit a lite cool mist.

import.name: Serenity

Any number of charges can be expelled for different effects: + ${2,orange}$ Charges: A recently fired arrow dips in temperature, dealing an additional 1d8 Cold damage after landing. + ${3,orange}$ Charges: Add your Wisdom modifier (${wis,orange}$) to your attack roll before you know if the attack will land or not. + ${5,orange}$ Charges: Take another full attack around. import.name: Calamity's Draw
import.description: Only holds arrows that were created, not a source of infinite arrows. When attacking, you may use a charge from this quiver to attack with one of the arrows inside. This quiver adds 1d8 Fire damage to the arrow. If the attack hits, perform a Dexterity save DC${20-wis,orange}$. On success, you may pull another arrow from this quiver to attempt to attack again as part of the current Attack action. The recipe for creating arrows known to the quiver yields ${10+wis,orange}$ arrows for 1 gold via a Transmutation enchantment.

import.name: Sight's Repose
import.description: A charge may be used to re-roll an Attack or Perception check. As a Reaction, ${3,orange}$ charges may be used for a friendly creature within ${30,orange}$ studs to reroll their Attack. import.name: Alisco's Cello
import.description: Made of a smooth metal and bearing crystalline runes in its neck, this cello gives off a faint blue glow when held. Requires care and maintenance to keep her in tune. If played while out of tune, it would likely hurt the ears of everyone ear by. With a quick fret, an arcane tuned burst of sound can lash out at a creature, causing Sonic damage. If you're attuned to this cello and have it in both hands (or in one hand with the other hand free), you can play (or continue playing) a tune on this cello as a Bonus Action. However, you can not take a Move Action and play the instrument in the same round. Currently, you're aware of 3 short tunes that can be played: 1. Folk Tune: Advantage on Wisdom saves and History checks to all friendly creatures who can hear you. 2. Jazz Tune: Advantage on Persuasion checks to all friendly creatures who can hear you. 3. Rock Tune: Advantage on Attack rolls to all friendly creatures who can hear you. You may know other tunes with other effects, check your Knowledge to see. The headstock also seems to have a socket for a power crystal...

import.name: Ring of Symphony
import.description: A golden resonating band with the slightest hum, considered a Symphonic ring. When worn and attuned, your body relieved by the hum. Whenever you suffer damage, the amount that isn't mitigated by resistances and such is then divided up among all other Symphonic rings that can hear the cry of this one. This damage can not be mitigated. Things to note: + Unattuning takes an Action to perform + The ring must be able to hear, this is independent of the attuned creature + Damage does still split to an unconscious creature, however after it dies the attunement is lost and therefore no longer split

import.name: Proxio's Mandate
import.description: Woven by an old wizard, Proxio. These bracers help an able bodied spell caster to maintain their composure. As an Action, you can recover a single spell slot. You suffer 2d8 + 4 Necrotic damage per level of spell slot restored. For instance, a Level 1 slot can recovered by suffering 2d8 + 4. A Level 2 for 4d8 + 8, or a Level 4 for 8d8 + 16. Should you fall unconscious after use, you still have the spell slot on being revived. You can not recover a spell slot to which you do not have access.

import.name: Black Lotus
import.description: A unique flower, with a purple core surrounded by black petals and a black stem. Exceedingly rare and having only been found in extremely dangerous wilderness, no botanist has managed to grow the flower. When consumed, if you are able to cast spells, you regain ${3,orange}$ levels of Spell Slots limited by your maximum spell slot: + ${3,orange}$ 1st Level + ${1,orange}$ 1st & ${1,orange}$ 2nd Level + ${1,orange}$ 3rd Level If you are unable to cast spells, roll 1d4: You gain a Spell Slot of that level until you take a Long Rest or Short Rest. If the slot is unused when you rest, the latent arcane energy is released randomly while you rest.

import.name: Amnesia Dust
import.description:
Dust slowly fills the pouch using the excess energy from the attuned creature.

When a creature is exposed to the dust, it must make a ${Wisdom,orange}$ DC${8 + wis,orange}$ save or forget the last ${minute,orange}$ from its memory.

However the dust is difficult to handle and you may expose yourself to the dust. When used, make a ${Sleight,orange}$ ${of,orange}$ ${Hand,orange}$ DC${10-dex,orange}$ Skill Check, and on failure you also forget the last minute.

Any creature effected by forgetfulness has its memory restored when exposed to a Level ${3,orange}$ or higher healing spell.

import.name: Andiziyo
import.description:
Seemingly just the hilt of a blade. As you examine it, the hilt produces an energy like blade. A culmination of the souls of all the creatures its slain, the blade of this dagger is a long purple beam. The beam giving no resistance or weight, causing it to behave like a dagger instead of a swird.

At the beginning of combat, make a ${Constitution,orange}$ DC${20-level,orange}$ save. On failure, using this blade causes 1d8 ${Necrotic,orange}$ damage with every strike as the blade drains your life force to power itself. Alternatively, a ${"content":"Red","class":"rs-red"}$ or ${"content":"Blue","class":"rs-blue"}$ ${"content":"Power Crystal","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ may be attached to the blade to satisfy the needs of the blade.

If a crystal is attached, roll 1d12 at the end of any combat. On a ${12,orange}$, the crystal shatters.

When a creature is slain by you, its life force is absorbed by this blade. This hilt is treated as the corpse of the dead for the purposes of things like ${"content":"Speak with the Dead","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ or ${"content":"Gentle Repose","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

When striking, charges can be expended from the hilt to various effects:
+ ${1,orange}$ Charge: Add ${1,orange}$d12 ${Necrotic,orange}$ damage
+ ${2,orange}$ Charges: If you've managed to hit, the hit is a critical hit
+ ${3,orange}$ Charges: Add ${3*wis,orange}$d12 ${Necrotic,orange}$ damage

If this blade is used while not attuned, the creature using the blade takes ${4,orange}$d8 ${Necrotic,orange}$ damage for every attack.
import.hiddenDescription: A purple runic handle with runic symbols inlaid along the hilt.

Additionally, a subtle ghostly clone shadows you, granting you an additional Reaction.

import.name: Researcher's Note
import.description:
Issues are continuing with their size, in some cases rampant growth after enchanting seems to come about at random, and others seem to burst into hundreds to thousands of smaller creatures.

We're trying to isolate the cause but this could be disastrous if unchecked.

import.name: Researcher's Note
import.description: We've lost control of the creatures, I'm leaving this note for the members who come to continue our research. What follows is smeared in blood, partially written in ink, runic symbols seem to be the important part. Some of the runes seem to have been finished in blood... Examining the runes, you've made out that the runes outline an enchantment ritual, partially in Ancient.
import.note:

Can absorb a soul if mishandled.

import.name: Ornimentor
import.description: A specially crafted war hammer head shapes around Blue Power Crystals. Once a power crystal has been consumed, a special blue lattice forms in the middle of the war hammer's head piece and glows gently. After giving a power crystal to the war hammer, add a charge to this war hammer. If it already has a charge, the war hammer will not accept the new crystal. As long as there is a crystal present, 1 ally within ${30,orange}$ studs of you slowly regenerate Temporary HP at ${wis,orange}$HP per minute, up to ${10,orange}$ Temporary HP. If you land a critical strike on a creature, you may command the lattice to shatter. If you do, calculate the damage done from the critical and then deal that much Cold damage as well.

import.name: See Journal: Researcher's Note: Resistances
import.description:
The Crystalline properties seem to result in the spiders acquiring a random set of resistances. Ironically the larger the size, the greater the number of resistances I observed, though the smaller spiders seem to be more capable of damage than the larger ones.

Small spiders seem to have 1 to 2 resistances while medium ones seem to always have 3, and a larger one seems to get up to 5 resistances.

Medium rolls until it has 3 unique resistances, where small and large merely roll 2 and 5 times respectively.

Resistance observed below (determined by 1d12):
1. Acid 
1. Cold 
1. Fire 
1. Force 
1. Holy 
1. Lightning 
1. Necrotic 
1. Poison 
1. Psychic 
1. Radiant 
1. Sonic 
1. Thunder
import.hiddenDescription: There seem to be some notes about various spider parts, but the handwriting is difficult to read...

import.name: See Journal: Researcher's Note: Instabilities
import.description: The crystalline properties present in the spiders, while appropriately dangerous, also appears to be somewhat unstable. On death, they seem to merely disperse, leaving no corpse. Which, while desired to leave no evidence of their incursions, has the added benefit of causing them to detonate on death when expressing the crystalline energy. This detonation seems to be inherent to their mass. Oddly, having the size to spread out the mass seems to help reduce the explosion size rather than increase it. According to my measurements the detonation is as follows: [Spider Size Multiplier] * ( [Spider HP] + [Damage Received] ) Sizing Multiplier: + Small: 3 + Medium: 2 + Large: 1 The type of damage seems to follow the crystal being expressed, though I've only managed to craft a measurable experiment for Red and Blue properties, I hope to produce the same for Orange soon once we receive our shipment from the Caravan. + Red: Fire + Blue: Cold
import.hiddenDescription: There seem to be some notes about various spider parts, but the handwriting is difficult to read...

import.name: Wandering Dust
import.description:
Allows the attuned creature to pull forth a handful of dust that can be cast across a floor, wall, or ceiling to create a portal.

To complete a portal, one handful of dust must be laid out somewhere and a small arcane chant said over it where a ${"content":"Arcana","class":"rs-orange"}$ Check is made. Then, in another location no more than ${40,orange}$ times your ${"content":"Wisdom","class":"rs-orange"}$ Modifier studs away (${40*wis,orange}$), another handful of dust can be scattered and another ${"content":"Arcana","class":"rs-orange"}$ Check made.

On success, a Portal is created that connects the 2 locations and allows at least ${int,orange}$ number of creatures through before collapsing, but may allow more.

The stability and success of the portal depend on a number of factors determined by where the portal is created and the difficulty involved will vary according. However, on a completely open unoccupied field, the portal can not fail to create.

<sub>There have been cases reported of people traveling through the portal finding themselves briefly in another realm and coming out with moderate ${"content":"Fire","class":"rs-orange"}$ or ${"content":"Poison","class":"rs-orange"}$ damage that seems to related to issues with portal stability.</sub>

Ironically the larger the size, the greater the number of resistances I observed, though the smaller spiders seem to be more capable of damage than the larger ones. Small spiders seem to have 1 to 2 resistances while medium ones seem to always have 3, and a larger one seems to get up to 5 resistances. Medium rolls until it has 3 unique resistances, where small and large merely roll 2 and 5 times respectively. Resistance observed below (determined by 1d12): 1. Acid 1. Cold 1. Fire 1. Force 1. Holy 1. Lightning 1. Necrotic 1. Poison 1. Psychic 1. Radiant 1. Sonic 1. Thunder --- # About Instability --- The crystalline properties present in the spiders, while appropriately dangerous, also appears to be somewhat unstable. On death, they seem to merely disperse, leaving no corpse. Which, while desired to leave no evidence of their incursions, has the added benefit of causing them to detonate on death when expressing the crystalline energy. This detonation seems to be inherent to their mass. Oddly, having the size to spread out the mass seems to help reduce the explosion size rather than increase it. According to my measurements the detonation is as follows: [Spider Size Multiplier] * ( [Spider HP] + [Damage Received] ) Sizing Multiplier: + Small: 3 + Medium: 2 + Large: 1 The type of damage seems to follow the crystal being expressed, though I've only managed to craft a measurable experiment for Red and Blue properties, I hope to produce the same for Orange soon once we receive our shipment from the Caravan. + Red: Fire + Blue: Cold --- # About Liquified Crystals --- We are running low on our supply of liquified crystals and will need a new shipment from the syndicate soon, I suspect it will cost some 100,000G to get it secured and safely to the lab. As I understand it, we are running low on our supply as a whole. The encyclopedias should have the information necessary for the liquification process as well as the rituals for combining the raw elements to create such vials as well. --- # About Spider Health --- Observing the spiders, they are quite hostile to other creatures and special containment has been necessary to allow us to study them effectively. Phasing them into an observable pocket dimension has proven useful as we are able to control what goes in and out, though the spiders do appear to weaken after a period inside the pocket dimension, even with adequate nutrient being pumped inside. What follows here-in is a ritual to create a controlled pocket dimension inside a simple cage. The enchantment seems to handle pumped air through the realm as well. Details on how to insert and remove objects appears to be detailed and extremely complicated, however seems to involve the use of 7th level spells. Under observation, the various sizes of the spiders seem to be proportional to their health. + Crystalline: 48 - 104 (40+8d8) + Small: 70 - 95 (65 + 5d6) + Medium: 105 - 130 (100 + 5d6) + Large: 125 - 150 (120 + 5d6) + Giant: 168 - 240 (160 + 8d10) + Monstrous: 320 - 500 (300 + 20d10) Unfortunately, we were not able to grow a crystalline spider much larger than a small one, but judging by the ferocity of its bite, we currently presume it to be more than enough. --- # About Spider Damage --- The damage the spiders can inflict from their mere fangs is as one would expect, the large the creature, the larger the fangs. However spiders towering over our larger ones seem more docile and are much slower. While I've witnessed them crush a panther to death and eat it whole, I'm not convinced a non-sedated panther could not kill one, or at least escape it. The larger ones and the smaller variants seem to possess the aggression we desire. Their base damage seems to be as follows (Ignoring stat bonuses and other effects imparted from their crystalline properties): + Large: 4d12 + Medium: 3d10 + Small: 2d8 The intriguing difference comes about their expression of their crystalline properties. Additionally, smaller creatures in all our experiments seemed to follow this rule so we expect similar results as we apply this to other creatures. Researching the Red Power Crystal effects, we observed the fang bites to have these properties: + Large: 1d8 Fire + Medium: 2d10 Fire + Small: 6d6 Fire As a special case, we were somewhat able to observe a Red Crystalline Spider but measurement proved problematic, however our highest measurement was ${68,orange}$: 11 Piercing and 57 Fire. All of that while still possessing the ability to poison a creature with its toxins. --- # About Crystalline Glows --- In allowing the crystalline spiders to breed, there seems to be a rare mutation that results in a seemingly White Glow accompanying its normal glow, giving them a lighter tint. I believe this is a spontaneous result in line with the text and rituals of the Divina Arcana, but without the text I can not confirm. Further research on these spiders may be a way to achieve parts of our goal without the Artifacts, but suspect this will take some time. I've arranged transport of half a dozen crystalline spiders that exhibit this glow to several other research outposts for further study. However be careful, they can appear docilie, but seem to be able to escape the dimensional cages if additional measurers aren't taken and refreshed periodically. The entry the continues with a set of arcane circles denoting a level 5 spel: Dimensional Containment
import.hiddenDescription: A research journal from Gravesend, appears to be written in Abyssal and seems to contain a number of notes and diagrams. May take some time to read and likely reveal some information. --- A research journal from Gravesend, appears to be written in Abyssal and seems to contain a number of notes and diagrams. Each section seems large enough to take a few hours to read and understand and a cursory check shows there appear to be several... --- Per Section: + ${5 - (dex/2), orange}$ Hours Reading, reduced by half your Dexterity modifier + Investigation Check DC${18,orange}$ to understand (Reduced by your Wisdom Modifier (${wis,orange}$) per failed check of that section) + Comprehension of Abyssal

import.name: Anulus Medius
import.description: A magical ring inlaid with green crystalline runes. While injured in combat, you heal every round for 1d12 HP. Outside of combat, your blood slows, healing you for 1d12 every hour. As an Action, a charge can be used to heal yourself or any creature you are touching for 1d12.
