import.name: Iphindawo
import.description: An old enchanted Elvish parchment of location. Once per day, a Wisdom save against this parchment and speak 1 word. The map reveals near-by locations of particular creatures or things based on the last spoken word and its interpretation there of. Range seems to be approximately ${5000,orange}$ studs but is subject to some natural and magical barriers. Once the map reaches any indicated point, the map turns off until the next day.
import.hiddenDescription: An old looking parchment that has a small glowing dot on it that seems to lie behind the barrier.
import.note:
+ Red Crystal: More damage against the tracked creature or object (Crystal consumed on a 1d6 6)
+ Blue: Tracks additional instances (Wis) (Crystal consumed on a 1d6 6)
+ Green: Reveal surrounding terrain (Crystal consumed on a 1d6 6)
+ Orange: (Consumes the Crystal) and Teleports the holder to the nearest occupiable space closest to the closest dot. 1 crystal per creature holding the scroll.
import._search: iphindawoitem:paper:findingan old enchanted elvish parchment of location. once per day, a wisdom save against this parchment and speak 1 word. the map reveals near-by locations of particular creatures or things based on the last spoken word and its interpretation there of. range seems to be approximately ${5000,orange}$ studs but is subject to some natural and magical barriers. once the map reaches any indicated point, the map turns off until the next day.+ red crystal: more damage against the tracked creature or object (crystal consumed on a 1d6 6) + blue: tracks additional instances (wis) (crystal consumed on a 1d6 6) + green: reveal surrounding terrain (crystal consumed on a 1d6 6) + orange: (consumes the crystal) and teleports the holder to the nearest occupiable space closest to the closest dot. 1 crystal per creature holding the scroll.?parchment

import.name: Reusable Spell Ink
import.description:
A magical well of Spell Copying Ink that slowly recharges over time as you rest.

When copying a spell, a charge may be used instead of an inkwell, however each charge can only be used as 1 inkwell for the purposes of copying at any given time.

While rare to find, multiple of these inkwells maybe used at once and multiple can be carried by a single creature.

import.name: Recipe: Healing Potions
import.description: Minor, Major, Arcane Elixirs! A complete guide to the potion of healing and its properties. Spending time reading this book will allow you to slowly learn to brew Minor Healing Potions and slowly build to larger healing potions or faster brewing. In combination with other known recipes, healing properties may become available to weave into your brews as you learn to understand the fundamentals of healing.

import.name: Enchanting Guide: Usherance
import.description: A guide to the Usherance Enchantment™. Contains detailed guides on the various arcane circles and sigils to enchant the weapons of the world with +1 to Attacks. Spending time reading this book will allow you to slowly learn to enchant objects with the Usherance enchantment, which counts as ${1,orange}$ enchantment level on the enchanted item and can be applied multiple times to the item. While this can be applied to any item, this is most commonly applied to weapons. If applied to a Jar of Pickles, the effect would be +1 to a Thrown Attack using that item.

import.description: A guide to the Refilling Enchantment™. Contains detailed guides on the various arcane circles and sigils to bring you your favorite brew every time. As other enchantments are learned or additional magics understood, you may be able to vary this enchantment.

import.name: Ring of Symphony
import.description: A golden resonating band with the slightest hum, considered a Symphonic ring. When worn and attuned, your body relieved by the hum. Whenever you suffer damage, the amount that isn't mitigated by resistances and such is then divided up among all other Symphonic rings that can hear the cry of this one. This damage can not be mitigated. Things to note: + Unattuning takes an Action to perform + The ring must be able to hear, this is independent of the attuned creature + Damage does still split to an unconscious creature, however after it dies the attunement is lost and therefore no longer split

import.name: Necklace of Sight
import.description:
A seeming plain but magical necklace allows the creature wearing it to see 60 studs farther than usual with crystal clarity, their eyes able to focus that much farther into the distance at will.

Known to help with finding and tracking things should one have the skill to do so already.

import.name: Skeleton Key
import.description:
A magical shifting key, known to quite adept at opening locks, in some cases even magical ones. However, once used, they almost always break, even if the lock in question was already unlocked or was quite simple.

They do however require a lock on which to operate. If no keyhole exists or the keyhole is jammed with broken lockpicks from previous attempts, this key can not be used.

import.name: Gimsteinn
import.description: A smooth and extremely well balanced, the blade is seemingly composed of nothing but the frost of air and the quilon formed from a blue power crystal, lending only more greatness to its balance. When struck by this blade, the frostly apparition that is the blade pierces almost all barriers and chills the victim. When thrown, the blade stays where it lands, but as long as the attuned maintains a free hand, on any Attack Action they can instead command the dagger to attack, from where it lay, any creature of which the attuned is reasonably aware. If the target of this special attack is further than ${200,orange}$ studs from you, this Attack Action is at disadvantage. If you can not see the creature but are aware of it, such as around a corner, then the target gets +5 Armor. This special Attack Action replaces the attack but still counts as an attack. So a Bonus Attack Action with a light weapon can still occur. If you have Extra Attack, this special action replaces only one of the Attack Actions. You also possess two special Actions to "move" the dagger. One to move the dagger to a special pocket dimension. Another to pull the dagger to your hand from the special pocket dimension. If you unattune from the dagger while it is in the pocket dimension, it appears at your feet.
import.hiddenDescription: An ornate dagger with a blue crystalline quilon.
import.note:
A legendary dagger wielded by the once great assassin Mondum Eruedel, forged by Via as a special request.

The dagger was created while Via was still in service to Crane Vox and has special divination magic hidden into it. Mondum was later killed by Lemuli after stealing magical scrolls from Crane.

actions.title: Dagger Jaunt
actions.info: If Gimsteinn is laying on the ground, for any reason, you may command Gimsteinn to attack a target from its current position, subject to its normal range and using your attack stats

actions.title: Shift Gimsteinn
actions.info: You move Gimsteinn from wherever it is to its Pocket Dimension.

actions.title: Retrieve Gimsteinn
actions.info: If Gimsteinn is in its pocket dimension, you retrieve it to a free hand (or your hand that already lists Gimsteinn as equipped).

import.name: Frickiyzie
import.description:
Potent pills that cause you to see otherworldly things. Enjoyed by dropping the pills into a large cauldron and enjoying the sugary beverage that comes forth.

Known to be quite messy. Partially from boiling over. Partially from the intoxicated spilling their drinks.

The shop keeps always note that the pills expire after some time, causing them to have no effect.
import.hiddenDescription: Unknown effects
import.note: Created from liquified power crystals, Curell sits on enchanted land created by Durong (Crane Vox) and in Curell these pills show other beings in an adjacent plane. These pills have no effect outside of Curell, but their secretive nature and that of Curell keeps many from noticing and the few that do assume they have a "bad batch" or that the pills have "gone bad".

import.name: Rasping Blade
import.description: A hearty blade seeming coated in a dark shadow. When a creature takes Necrotic damage from this blade, the attuned creature heals for that much damage.
import.hiddenDescription: A haunting dark shadow follows the blade of this sword.
import.note: If wielded by someone who is not a devoted follower of Cthulhu, when healed this way, the user is slowly corrupted gaining 1 point of corruption per point healed. If the corruption reaches the max hp of the user they are cursed and can no longer heal dying over 3 rounds after which their corpse is animated and turned into a servant of Cthulhu. Decursing the creature removes the curse and the corpse drops to the ground. If decursed before being animated, the curse drops and they immediately count as dead. The corpse counts as dead starting from when they were first animated.

import.name: Wallmaker
import.description: Seemingly simple heavy plate armor enchanted with protection magic. A charge may be used to instantly construct a ${10,orange}$ stud wide, ${5,orange}$ stud high, ${1,orange}$ stud thick wall centered on you up to 5 studs away and can not intersect with a creature (alive or dead). Any number of charges can be used at once to construct a wall with additional length, height, or thickness. The wall is considered magical and persists for ${con,orange}$ minutes. Once constructed, you are not able to dismiss the wall though Dispel Magic and similar effects will instantly remove it. If the wall intersects with prexisting terrain, buildings, or other features it stops at them either meeting flush with them to finish its construction or stopping at them depending on the nature of the impediment. Max charges scale with your Constitution modifier (${con,orange}$).
import._search: wallmakeritem:chest:wallmakerseemingly simple heavy plate armor enchanted with protection magic. a charge may be used to instantly construct a ${10,orange}$ stud wide, ${5,orange}$ stud high, ${1,orange}$ stud thick wall centered on you up to 5 studs away and can not intersect with a creature (alive or dead). any number of charges can be used at once to construct a wall with additional length, height, or thickness. the wall is considered magical and persists for ${con,orange}$ minutes. once constructed, you are not able to dismiss the wall though dispel magic and similar effects will instantly remove it. if the wall intersects with prexisting terrain, buildings, or other features it stops at them either meeting flush with them to finish its construction or stopping at them depending on the nature of the impediment. max charges scale with your constitution modifier (${con,orange}$).armor modifier:item:armor:heavy

import.name: Googler
import.description: A divine charm that helps the user find information. While inside any building you may ask the charm 1 question, composed of 1 sentence, no longer than 10 words. The charm then shines brightly for a 6 seconds before instilling your mind with an answer. Covering or obscuring the light causes the charm to fail to find an answer. Max charges scale with your Wisdom modifier (${int,orange}$).

import.name: Render's Chakram
import.description: A little known but complex weapon. Can be thrown very accurately at short distances or simply used similar to a dagger. Works the same in main hand or off hand. When attacking, you may choose up to 3 targets and the order in which they will be struck. Each must be within range of the weapon from the last struck creature. These must be chosen before your attack is made. Additionally, any charges to be used must be chosen before attacks are made as well. Once you've chosen your attacks, make your Attack roll. On success, the Chakram hits and heads toward the next target or returns to you. On failure, the creature that was struck can make a Dexterity save against your Attack roll, and on success catches the Chakram. A critical failure on your Attack roll results in the Chakram falling to the ground at the target. If you fail 2 hits in a row, the Chakram flies off in a random direction. If the direction is towards you, it is not considered catchable. A single failure in a thrown attack results in the Chakram returning but requiring a Dexterity save to catch, with DC 10 * [Number of targets]. If the save is failed, you take the weapon's damage and it falls to your feet. When a creature is struck by this Chakrum, it must make a Constitution save at 36 / ( 1 + [Number of Targets]), and on failure receive the Bleeding effect and bleed for 1d6 Slashing damage per round until a save is successful or until healed.

import.name: Disarming Gloves
import.description: Made of enchanted leather, the gloves are resistant to damage and may be used a few times a day to attempt to disarm an attacker using a weapon that is ${8,orange}$ blocks in size or smaller. On a failed Attack against you, you may make a Sleight of Hand roll against the Attack roll and on success, the attacker's weapon is thrown to the ground. If you have a free hand, you may instead opt to take the weapon into your free hand if the weapon is usable in that situation. As a limited set of examples, an offhand weapon must be 6 blocks or smaller, or if the weapon would cause you to exceed your carry capacity. More cases exist. The maximum number of charges scales with your Dexterity modifier (${dex,orange}$).

import.name: Rasping Blade (NPC)
import.description: A hearty blade seeming coated in a dark shadow. When a creature takes Necrotic damage from this blade, the attuned creature heals for that much damage.
import.hiddenDescription: A haunting dark shadow follows the blade of this sword.
import.note: If wielded by someone who is not a devoted follower of Cthulhu, when healed this way, the user is slowly corrupted gaining 1 point of corruption per point healed. If the corruption reaches the max hp of the user they are cursed and can no longer heal dying over 3 rounds after which their corpse is animated and turned into a servant of Cthulhu. Decursing the creature removes the curse and the corpse drops to the ground. If decursed before being animated, the curse drops and they immediately count as dead. The corpse counts as dead starting from when they were first animated.

import.name: Head of Omoyo Zenic
import.description: [ Last Spoken to on Alucevum 8, 319 ] After dying while chauffering Mrs. Dinoir from the city of Curell, his body was later collected after bing found invisible hidden in bushes near the side of the road. After being taken back to the warden Garrison, the party was able to pick his bodyout from the still invisible corpses thanks to talking to Mrs. Dinoir and asked him some questions after severing his head so that they could use Speak with the Dead and ask some additional questions later. Questions from Alucevum 8, 319: + Have you ever seen or heard of a snake/humanoid hybrid? No, can’t say that I have + What do you remember before you passed away? Trying to get Mrs. Dinoir to safety + Do you know who the investigators Mrs. Dinoir hired? Athis and Cesis + Was there anything unusual about the carriage you drove yesterday? Nope, handled just fine + Do you know anything about a powerful invisibility spell? No, don’t know much about it
import.note: Decapitated on Alucevum 8, 319

import.name: Crosswind
import.description: A small and lightweight bow magically reinforced to give it more power and range. Any number of charges can be used in one turn and the charges scale with your Dexterity modifier (${dex,orange}$): + 1 Charge: Add 1d10 Lightning Damage + 2 Charges: On an Attack Action, take an additional shot + 4 Charges: [ Must use before your Attack Roll ] Your next fired arrow deals double its rolled damage if it hits (This may be used multiple times in one turn between shots.) + 6 Charges: A strong breeze follows you and your attacks. You gain ${dex,orange}$ additional movement and deal an additional ${dex,orange}$ Piercing damage on successful attacks. These scale with your Dexterity modifier (${dex,orange}$).

import.name: Wind Step
import.description: Enchanted with the winds. Once attuned, these boots can summon the wind beneath your feet thick enough for you to step off of, effectively allowing you to jump again. This effect however is difficult to control. The wind can be summoned 10 times in a row before they need 1 round to recharge. However, each jump requires a Dexterity save. A charge can be used in lieu of a Dexterity save. Maximum number of charges scales with your Wisdom modifier (${wis,orange}$).

import.name: Investigators
import.description: A thin silver frame holds these enchanted lenses in place, small golden inlaid runes at the very bottom of each. When attuned with the glasses, you gain a slight bonus to Investigation and Perception as well as immunity to Blindness. While attuned, you may also use charges throughout the day: + ${1,orange}$ Charge: Name an object you know of and can picture in your mind. If an object matching that object is within 30 studs of you and in the same room, you are able to see a faint golden trail that will lead you to it. Does not work outside. + ${2,orange}$ Charges: Re-roll any Investigation or Perception check that reasonably involve the use of sight + ${4,orange}$ Charges: You gain the ability to see through a wall no thicker than 3 studs for 1 minute + ${8,orange}$ Charges: You critically succeed your Investigation check. This may be used after you have made the roll, but must be before you know if you have succeeded. Maximum number of charges scales with your Charisma modifier (${cha, orange}$) and use of these glasses constitutes use of Divination magic.

import.name: Alchemy Recipe: Carrec Bread
import.description: Allows one to bake Carrec Bread. An extremely old recipe. However, the process is quite finicky and the recipe on this scroll lists the several dozen ways the process can go wrong and how to account for it, making this scroll required for those new to making the delicacy. However due to this finickiness and the sheer cost of materials to make it and its very limited use to the everyday person, the bread has fallen to the wayside of things made in the modern world. --- Carrec Bread: An extremely expensive delicacy for the non-adventurer, know for it's unique and delicious sweet & spicy taste as well as bringing renewed energy to its consumer. import.name: Cake
import.description: A tasty treat that when consumed grants 1 Temporary HP and possibly other whimsical effects. If 3 are consumed within an hour, you gain the Stuffed effect, giving disadvantage on Constitution saves. Consuming too many may have nauseating effects.

import.name: Blessing of Cthulhu
import.description: An artifact blessed by Cthulhu for his priests to carry while manifested in other realms. A single charge can used as an Action or a Reaction to move one effect from one creature to another. If the effect was created by a level ${7,orange}$ spell or higher, you must make a Charisma save against the original caster's spell DC unless a power crystal is channeled with this blessing. If you are a Priest of Cthulhu, a charge can be used at anytime to instill chaos on the battle field. Roll 1d100 to pull energy from Skapari, the realm of discord. If you are not a Priest of the God of Chaos, then this effect triggers randomly.
import.note:
+ 1-15: Random explosions on the battle field for 3d6 Fire Damage
+ 16-33: 1d6 creatures swap positions
+ 34-56: All saves are inverted (Fails are saves and saves are fails). You have disadvantage on all Saves.
+ 57-84: AC is inverted. All attacks against you are at advantage.
+ 85-99: Pools of Liquid Power Crystal span randomly.
+ 100: All beneficial buffs for your foes that are not divine or infused with Power Crystals are nullified

import.name: Amulet of Arcane Divinity
import.description: A powerful amulet bristling with power. When near, there is a noticeable increase in pressure in the room and its power is almost palpable. A tri-colored gem sits in the middle of this amulet; Orange, Lime, and Yellow. All glowing faintly in unison, particles near the stone seeming to vibrate and shimmer, giving it a particularly spectacular glow. A charge may be used construct an Arcane Orbital using 1 or more Power Crystals.
